result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney Rose Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Deceased
Order to Forgive Unpaid Court Obligations - Deceased
REVOKED - SENTENCED TO CO. JAIL/HOC (CIVIL JUDGMENT IN PLACE)
I adjusted $40 off of the assessment for restitution, based on information from DOC/WICs system.  Printout scanned.

11:11 AM Defendant Courtney Rose Roberts in court with attorney Christian J Ness appears by telephone.  Defendant Courtney Rose Roberts in custody apepars by video.  Bruce Poquette appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reporter appears by telephone.    Appearances by telephone through the conference bridge  due to the Supreme Court Order regarding the Public Health Crisis of COVID-19.   All parties have received the revocation and warrant, have reviewed and no corrections.    State recites stiputation.    All parties agree.   Attny  Ness makes final statement.   DEF makes no statement to court.    Court to follow stipulation.  

COURT:  9 months jail, good time, huber.   125 days jail credit.   Any unpaid court obligations are to be converted to Clerk of Court collect and civil judgment will be entered.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 5, 2020 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Courtney Rose Roberts in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court finds defendant has freely waived her right to an attorney.  Defendant entered plea of no contest.  Court finds defendant guilty.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs of $453.00 total - restitution due to Walmart Hayward $1263.68 plus surcharge(s)

Defendant Courtney Rose Roberts in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:58 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Defendant does not feel she needs an atty - she is temporarily waiving her right to an atty to speak to the D.A.  Court advised her to go to the DA's office to set up an appointment.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
No contact with Walmart.
